shapes

Class Shape

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes.Shape
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Circle, ConvexPolygon, Point

    public abstract class Shape
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Detail

      • direction

        protected Direction direction

      • center

        protected Point center

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shape

        public Shape()
        Constructs a new shape with default values. Overriding constructors should call super() to ensure that Game.addShape() is called, and should call setup().

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public abstract void setup()
        Initializes the Shape. When you subclass shape, you'll override this method to do things like set the shape's color, set its starting position, etc.

      • update

        public abstract void update()
        Updates the shape once per frame. When you subclass shape, you'll override this method to do things like move the shape, change its size, etc.

      • contains

        public abstract boolean contains(Shape s)
        Checks if this shape contains another given shape.
        Parameters:
        s - the shape that may be contained in this shape.
        Returns:
        true if s is entirely inside this shape, false otherwise.

      • contains

        public abstract boolean contains(Point p)
        Checks if this shape contains a given point.
        Parameters:
        p - a point to check for inside this shape.
        Returns:
        true if p is inside or on the border of this shape.

      • setCenter

        public void setCenter(double x,
             double y)
        Changes the location of this shape.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of this shape's new center
        y - the y-coordinate of this shape's new center

      • isTouching

        public boolean isTouching(Shape s)
        Checks if this shape is touching another shape.
        Parameters:
        s - the shape to check.
        Returns:
        true if this shape is touching s, false otherwise.

      • isOffscreen

        public abstract boolean isOffscreen()
        TODO

      • isTouchingBorder

        public boolean isTouchingBorder()
        Checks if this shape is touching the border of the window.
        Returns:
        true if any part of the shape is touching the border of the window, or if the shape is entirely outside the window, and false otherwise.

      • move

        public void move(double pixels)
        Moves in the shape's direction. Moves pixels pixels in the direction set using setDirection(). Won't move through solid shapes.
        Parameters:
        pixels - the distance to move.
        See Also:
        move(Direction, double), setDirection(Direction)

      • move

        public void move(Direction direction,
        double pixels)
        Moves in the given direction. Moves pixels pixels in the given direction. Won't move through solid shapes.
        Parameters:
        pixels - the distance to move.
        direction - the direction in which to move.
        See Also:
        move(double)

      • isClicked

        public boolean isClicked()
        Checks if this shape was clicked since the previous frame. Returns true if:
        • the mouse button was clicked inside this shape since the last frame
        • the mouse was dragged into this shape while the mouse button was down, and is currently inside this shape
        Returns:
        true if this shape was clicked since the previous frame, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Mouse.clickLocation()

      • moveRight

        public void moveRight(double pixels)
        Moves right.

        Moves pixels pixels to the right. Won't move through solid shapes.

        Parameters:
        pixels - the distance to move.
        See Also:
        move(Direction, double)

      • moveLeft

        public void moveLeft(double pixels)
        Moves left.

        Moves pixels pixels to the left. Won't move through solid shapes.

        Parameters:
        pixels - the distance to move.
        See Also:
        move(Direction, double)

      • moveUp

        public void moveUp(double pixels)
        Moves up.

        Moves pixels pixels to the up. Won't move through solid shapes.

        Parameters:
        pixels - the distance to move.
        See Also:
        move(Direction, double)

      • moveDown

        public void moveDown(double pixels)
        Moves down.

        Moves pixels pixels to the down. Won't move through solid shapes.

        Parameters:
        pixels - the distance to move.
        See Also:
        move(Direction, double)

      • say

        public void say(java.lang.String speech)
        Displays text near this shape. Continues speaking until this method is called again with new text.
        Parameters:
        speech - what the shape says.
        See Also:
        say(String, int), setSpeechColor(Color), getSpeech(), isSpeaking()

      • say

        public void say(java.lang.String speech,
       int frames)
        Displays text near this shape for a limited time.
        Parameters:
        speech - what the shape says.
        frames - how long the shape speaks.
        See Also:
        say(String), setSpeechColor(Color), getSpeech(), isSpeaking()

      • getSpeech

        public java.lang.String getSpeech()
        Returns what this shape is saying.
        Returns:
        what this shape is saying, or null if the shape isn't saying anything.
        See Also:
        say(String, int), say(String)

      • setSpeechColor

        public void setSpeechColor(java.awt.Color speechColor)
        Sets the color of this shape's speech.
        Parameters:
        speechColor - the color of this shape's speech.
        See Also:
        getSpeechColor()

      • getSpeechColor

        public java.awt.Color getSpeechColor()
        Returns the color of this shape's speech.
        Returns:
        the color of this shape's speech.
        See Also:
        setSpeechColor(Color)

      • isSpeaking

        public boolean isSpeaking()
        Returns true if the shape is currently speaking.
        Returns:
        true if the shape is speaking, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        say(String, int), say(String), getSpeech()

      • towards

        public Direction towards(Point target)
        Returns the direction of a given point relative to this shape. Can be used to move(double) this shape towards a point: this.move(this.towards(targetPoint), 10.0);
        Parameters:
        target - the point to aim towards.
        Returns:
        the direction of target relative to this shape, or null if target is null.
        See Also:
        towards(Shape), move(Direction, double), setDirection(Direction)

      • towards

        public Direction towards(Shape target)
        Returns the direction of a shape relative to this shape. Can be used to move(double) this shape towards another shape: this.move(this.towards(targetShape), 10.0);
        Parameters:
        target - the shape to aim towards.
        Returns:
        the direction of target's relative to this shape's center.
        See Also:
        towards(Point), move(Direction, double), setDirection(Direction)

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys this shape so it will no longer be rendered. Call this method when you have finished using the shape.

      • isDestroyed

        public boolean isDestroyed()
        Returns true if this shape has been destroyed.
        Returns:
        true if destroy() has been called on this shape, false otherwise.
